data.question: What is the source of the chemicals used in the study?
data.answer: Sigma Aldrich and Ranbaxy Fine Chemicals

data.question: What method was used for Single crystal X-ray structural studies?
data.answer: CCD Agilent Technologies (Oxford Diffraction) SUPER NOVA diffractometer

data.question: What was the temperature at which electrochemical experiments were performed?
What type of electrode was used as the working electrode in the electrochemical experiments?
What was the purpose of using FE-SEM and AFM in the study?
data.answer: To analyze the surface morphology of metal sample

data.question: What bacterial strain was used for the antibacterial activity study?
What assay was performed to study the antiproliferative activity?
What was the main finding from the antibacterial activity test?
data.answer: Both azido complexes showed moderate anti-bacterial activity against MRSA

data.question: True or False: The study found that complex 4 showed high antiproliferative activity against breast cancer cell line MCF 7.
What was the main conclusion of the study regarding the corrosion inhibition by the synthesized Zn (II) Schiff base complexes?
data.answer: The synthesized azido zinc complexes 3 and 4 showed considerable anti-corrosion property

data.question: True or False: The study used a three-electrode assembly for all electrochemical experiments.
What was the scan rate used in the potentiodynamic polarization measurement?
True or False: The study concluded that azido complexes have potential as corrosion inhibitors for mild steel.
What was the main advantage of using azide as a co-ligand in the complexes?
data.answer: It may increase the absorption capacity on mild steel

data.question: True or False: The study performed antibacterial activity tests against a fungal species.
